description.highlights: The Black House is a collection of around 40 buildings with various unique styles and designs, accommodating Thawan Duchanee's collections of artwork and items from around the world.
description.shape: The buildings have varying shapes and sizes and incorporate various architectural styles, including Balinese and Burmese.
description.spatial design: The highlight of its shape and form is the diversity of structures and the integration of different architectural influences scattered around a peaceful garden.
description.material design: The highlight in its spatial and material design is the usage of different materials such as wood, glass, concrete, bricks, and terracotta, as well as the incorporation of animal bones, skins, horns, and items made from silver and gold in the interiors.
description.keywords: Black House, Thawan Duchanee, architecture, Thai modern art, varied structures, peaceful garden, animal bones, Balinese architecture, Burmese architecture, Ayutthaya Period, international reputation, sculptures, paintings

facade.highlights: The highlight of this design is the steeply sloped roofs and intricate wooden carvings.
facade.shape: It utilizes a multi-tiered, gabled form common in traditional Southeast Asian architecture.
facade.spatial design: The highlight of its shape and form includes the pointed finials and the tiered roof structure that create a flowing, ornamental outline against the sky.
facade.material design: The highlight in its spatial and material design is the use of dark wood for both structure and ornamentation, which gives a natural and rich appearance that blends with the surrounding greenery.
facade.keywords: steeply sloped roofs, wooden carvings, gabled, multi-tiered, Southeast Asian architecture, pointed finials, natural wood, rich appearance, traditional design

interior.highlights: The intricate wooden carvings and traditional aesthetic
interior.shape: Primarily rectilinear with vertical column supports
interior.spatial design: Open space with vertical emphasis due to tall columns and high ceiling
interior.material design: Use of natural wood and traditional carving techniques evident in the ornate detailing
interior.keywords: Traditional, Wooden, Carvings, Ornate, Rectilinear, Open space, High ceiling

interior2.highlights: The highlight of this design is its intricate wooden carvings and traditional gabled roof structure, common in Thai architecture.
interior2.shape: The structure has a gabled roof with multi-tiered, elongated eaves that extend dramatically on either side, and a pronounced ridge, typifying the traditional shapes seen in Southeast Asian temples.
interior2.spatial design: The highlight of its shape and form is the tiered roof design that adds height and elegance, with the sweeping eaves that create a sense of grandeur.
interior2.material design: The highlight in its spatial and material design is the extensive use of wood and the detailed craftsmanship evident in the carvings and joinery, presenting a harmonious blend with the natural surroundings.
interior2.keywords: Traditional, Thai architecture, wooden carvings, gabled roof, multi-tiered eaves, intricate craftsmanship, natural materials, temple, elegance, cultural design
